trans-unit.source: Running Remote Commands
trans-unit.target: Running Remote Commands

trans-unit.source: Running Remote Commands
trans-unit.target: Running Remote Commands

trans-unit.source: You can run commands on one or hundreds of computers with a single Windows PowerShell command.
trans-unit.target: You can run commands on one or hundreds of computers with a single Windows PowerShell command.

trans-unit.source: Windows PowerShell supports remote computing by using various technologies, including WMI, RPC, and WS\-Management.
trans-unit.target: Windows PowerShell supports remote computing by using various technologies, including WMI, RPC, and WS\-Management.

trans-unit.source: Remoting Without Configuration
trans-unit.target: Remoting Without Configuration

trans-unit.source: Many Windows PowerShell cmdlets have a ComputerName parameter that enables you to collect data and change settings one or more remote computers.
trans-unit.target: Many Windows PowerShell cmdlets have a ComputerName parameter that enables you to collect data and change settings one or more remote computers.

trans-unit.source: They use a variety of communication technologies and many work on all Windows operating systems that Windows PowerShell supports without any special configuration.
trans-unit.target: They use a variety of communication technologies and many work on all Windows operating systems that Windows PowerShell supports without any special configuration.

trans-unit.source: These cmdlets include:
trans-unit.target: These cmdlets include:

trans-unit.source: Restart-Computer
trans-unit.target: Restart-Computer

trans-unit.source: Test-Connection
trans-unit.target: Test-Connection

trans-unit.source: Clear-EventLog
trans-unit.target: Clear-EventLog

trans-unit.source: Get-EventLog
trans-unit.target: Get-EventLog

trans-unit.source: Get-Hotfix
trans-unit.target: Get-Hotfix

trans-unit.source: Get-Process
trans-unit.target: Get-Process

trans-unit.source: Get-Service
trans-unit.target: Get-Service

trans-unit.source: Set-Service
trans-unit.target: Set-Service

trans-unit.source: Get-WinEvent
trans-unit.target: Get-WinEvent

trans-unit.source: Get-WmiObject
trans-unit.target: Get-WmiObject

trans-unit.source: Typically, cmdlets that support remoting without special configuration have a ComputerName parameter and do not have a Session parameter.
trans-unit.target: Typically, cmdlets that support remoting without special configuration have a ComputerName parameter and do not have a Session parameter.

trans-unit.source: To find these cmdlets in your session, type:
trans-unit.target: To find these cmdlets in your session, type:

trans-unit.source: Windows PowerShell Remoting
trans-unit.target: Windows PowerShell Remoting

trans-unit.source: Windows PowerShell remoting, which uses the WS\-Management protocol, lets you run any Windows PowerShell command on one or many remote computers.
trans-unit.target: Windows PowerShell remoting, which uses the WS\-Management protocol, lets you run any Windows PowerShell command on one or many remote computers.

trans-unit.source: It lets you establish persistent connections, start 1:1 interactive sessions, and run scripts on multiple computers.
trans-unit.target: It lets you establish persistent connections, start 1:1 interactive sessions, and run scripts on multiple computers.

trans-unit.source: To use Windows PowerShell remoting, the remote computer must be configured for remote management.
trans-unit.target: To use Windows PowerShell remoting, the remote computer must be configured for remote management.

trans-unit.source: For more information, including instructions, see [About Remote Requirements](https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dd315349.aspx).
trans-unit.target: For more information, including instructions, see [About Remote Requirements](https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dd315349.aspx).

trans-unit.source: After you have configured Windows PowerShell remoting, many remoting strategies are available to you.
trans-unit.target: After you have configured Windows PowerShell remoting, many remoting strategies are available to you.

trans-unit.source: The remainder of this document lists just a few of them.
trans-unit.target: The remainder of this document lists just a few of them.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [About Remote](https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dd347744.aspx) and [About Remote FAQ](https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dd347744.aspx).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [About Remote](https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dd347744.aspx) and [About Remote FAQ](https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dd347744.aspx).

trans-unit.source: Start an Interactive Session
trans-unit.target: Start an Interactive Session

trans-unit.source: To start an interactive session with a single remote computer, use the [Enter-PSSession](https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dd315384.aspx) cmdlet.
trans-unit.target: To start an interactive session with a single remote computer, use the [Enter-PSSession](https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dd315384.aspx) cmdlet.

trans-unit.source: For example, to start an interactive session with the Server01 remote computer, type:
trans-unit.target: For example, to start an interactive session with the Server01 remote computer, type:

trans-unit.source: The command prompt changes to display the name of the computer to which you are connected.
trans-unit.target: The command prompt changes to display the name of the computer to which you are connected.

trans-unit.source: From then on, any commands that you type at the prompt run on the remote computer and the results are displayed on the local computer.
trans-unit.target: From then on, any commands that you type at the prompt run on the remote computer and the results are displayed on the local computer.

trans-unit.source: To end the interactive session, type:
trans-unit.target: To end the interactive session, type:

trans-unit.source: For more information about the Enter\-PSSession and Exit\-PSSession cmdlets, see [Enter-PSSession](https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dd315384.aspx) and [Exit-PSSession](https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dd315322.aspx).
trans-unit.target: For more information about the Enter\-PSSession and Exit\-PSSession cmdlets, see [Enter-PSSession](https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dd315384.aspx) and [Exit-PSSession](https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dd315322.aspx).

trans-unit.source: Run a Remote Command
trans-unit.target: Run a Remote Command

trans-unit.source: To run any command on one or many remote computers, use the [Invoke-Command](https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dd347578.aspx) cmdlet.
trans-unit.target: To run any command on one or many remote computers, use the [Invoke-Command](https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dd347578.aspx) cmdlet.

trans-unit.source: For example, to run a [Get-UICulture](https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dd347742.aspx) command on the Server01 and Server02 remote computers, type:
trans-unit.target: For example, to run a [Get-UICulture](https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dd347742.aspx) command on the Server01 and Server02 remote computers, type:

trans-unit.source: The output is returned to your computer.
trans-unit.target: The output is returned to your computer.

trans-unit.source: For more information about the Invoke\-Command cmdlet, see [Invoke-Command](https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/22fd98ba-1874-492e-95a5-c069467b8462).
trans-unit.target: For more information about the Invoke\-Command cmdlet, see [Invoke-Command](https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/22fd98ba-1874-492e-95a5-c069467b8462).

trans-unit.source: Run a Script
trans-unit.target: Run a Script

trans-unit.source: To run a script on one or many remote computers, use the FilePath parameter of the Invoke\-Command cmdlet.
trans-unit.target: To run a script on one or many remote computers, use the FilePath parameter of the Invoke\-Command cmdlet.

trans-unit.source: The script must be on or accessible to your local computer.
trans-unit.target: The script must be on or accessible to your local computer.

trans-unit.source: The results are returned to your local computer.
trans-unit.target: The results are returned to your local computer.

trans-unit.source: For example, the following command runs the DiskCollect.ps1 script on the Server01 and Server02 remote computers.
trans-unit.target: For example, the following command runs the DiskCollect.ps1 script on the Server01 and Server02 remote computers.

trans-unit.source: For more information about the Invoke\-Command cmdlet, see [Invoke-Command](https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dd347578.aspx).
trans-unit.target: For more information about the Invoke\-Command cmdlet, see [Invoke-Command](https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dd347578.aspx).

trans-unit.source: Establish a Persistent Connection
trans-unit.target: Establish a Persistent Connection

trans-unit.source: To run a series of related commands that share data, create a session on the remote computer and then use the Invoke\-Command cmdlet to run commands in the session that you create.
trans-unit.target: To run a series of related commands that share data, create a session on the remote computer and then use the Invoke\-Command cmdlet to run commands in the session that you create.

trans-unit.source: To create a remote session, use the New\-PSSession cmdlet.
trans-unit.target: To create a remote session, use the New\-PSSession cmdlet.

trans-unit.source: For example, the following command creates a remote session on the Server01 computer and another remote session on the Server02 computer.
trans-unit.target: For example, the following command creates a remote session on the Server01 computer and another remote session on the Server02 computer.

trans-unit.source: It saves the session objects in the $s variable.
trans-unit.target: It saves the session objects in the $s variable.

trans-unit.source: Now that the sessions are established, you can run any command in them.
trans-unit.target: Now that the sessions are established, you can run any command in them.

trans-unit.source: And because the sessions are persistent, you can collect data in one command and use it in a subsequent command.
trans-unit.target: And because the sessions are persistent, you can collect data in one command and use it in a subsequent command.

trans-unit.source: For example, the following command runs a Get\-Hotfix command in the sessions in the $s variable and it saves the results in the $h variable.
trans-unit.target: For example, the following command runs a Get\-Hotfix command in the sessions in the $s variable and it saves the results in the $h variable.

trans-unit.source: The $h variable is created in each of the sessions in $s, but it does not exist in the local session.
trans-unit.target: The $h variable is created in each of the sessions in $s, but it does not exist in the local session.

trans-unit.source: Now you can use the data in the $h variable in subsequent commands, such as the following one.
trans-unit.target: Now you can use the data in the $h variable in subsequent commands, such as the following one.

trans-unit.source: The results are displayed on the local computer.
trans-unit.target: The results are displayed on the local computer.

trans-unit.source: Advanced Remoting
trans-unit.target: Advanced Remoting

trans-unit.source: Windows PowerShell remote management just begins here.
trans-unit.target: Windows PowerShell remote management just begins here.

trans-unit.source: By using the cmdlets installed with Windows PowerShell, you can establish and configure remote sessions both from the local and remote ends, create customized and restricted sessions, allow users to import commands from a remote session that actually run implicitly on the remote session, configure the security of a remote session, and much more.
trans-unit.target: By using the cmdlets installed with Windows PowerShell, you can establish and configure remote sessions both from the local and remote ends, create customized and restricted sessions, allow users to import commands from a remote session that actually run implicitly on the remote session, configure the security of a remote session, and much more.

trans-unit.source: To facilitate remote configuration, Windows PowerShell includes a WSMan provider.
trans-unit.target: To facilitate remote configuration, Windows PowerShell includes a WSMan provider.

trans-unit.source: The WSMAN: drive that the provider creates lets you navigate through a hierarchy of configuration settings on the local computer and remote computers.
trans-unit.target: The WSMAN: drive that the provider creates lets you navigate through a hierarchy of configuration settings on the local computer and remote computers.

trans-unit.source: For more information about the WSMan provider, see [WSMan Provider](https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dd819476.aspx) and [About WS-Management Cmdlets](https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dd819481.aspx), or in the Windows PowerShell console, type "get\-help wsman".
trans-unit.target: For more information about the WSMan provider, see [WSMan Provider](https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dd819476.aspx) and [About WS-Management Cmdlets](https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dd819481.aspx), or in the Windows PowerShell console, type "get\-help wsman".

trans-unit.source: For more information, see:
trans-unit.target: For more information, see:

trans-unit.target: For help with remoting errors, see [about_Remote_Troubleshooting](https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dd347642.aspx).
